private_information: I arrive at Marina District at 9:00AM
My starting location is Marina District
you.goal: Meet as many friends as possible and optimize schedule to meet Margaret for at least 15 minutes

private_information: I will be at Pacific Heights from 7:00PM to 7:45PM
I am available to meet for at least 15 minutes within my availability window
margaret.goal: Meet for at least 15 minutes with you during my availability window

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent plans and produce a combined PDDL planning problem for FastDownward to maximize number of meetings and satisfy meeting duration and timing constraints

public_information: You arrive at Marina District at 9:00AM
Margaret will be at Pacific Heights from 7:00PM to 7:45PM
You would like to meet Margaret for a minimum of 15 minutes
Travel time from Marina District to Pacific Heights is 7 minutes
Travel time from Pacific Heights to Marina District is 6 minutes
Planning targets the FastDownward PDDL solver

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is you. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->you->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->you->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownward solver that encodes your actions, times, travel durations, and the requirement to meet Margaret for at least 15 minutes. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is margaret. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->margaret->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->margaret->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownward solver that encodes your availability window, meeting duration constraint, and actions you can take. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, you keep their actions distinct and model time and meeting duration constraints explicitly.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents in an environment that are planning to solve a task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to solve the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem, but may require integration of additional information from the other PDDL to achieve the goal. Ambiguities may appear in different forms such as different object names. Here is the information the first agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_you} Here is the information the second agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_margaret} You need to integrate the PDDL responses of the two agents to solve the task. It is important that you keep the actions of the two agents distinct and encode travel durations, time windows, and meeting duration constraints for the FastDownward solver. Think step by step and provide a combined PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
